alert.note: Alert for Eastern Uinta Basin; Tavaputs Plateau (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 2:16PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Rio Blanco and east central Uintah Counties through 245 PM MDT... At 216 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 20 miles south of Dinosaur, or 40 miles southeast of Vernal, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Rio Blanco and east central Uintah Counties. This includes Colorado 64 between mile markers 4 and 19. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
